result.execSummary:
The defendant Elmer O Ramirez-Milian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Harboring/Aiding a Felon (A/B/C/D or unclassified felony/life) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.47(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

charges.descr: Harboring/Aiding a Felon (A/B/C/D or unclassified felony/life)

Stip to amend cash bail, granted. Parties request to remove trial dates and set for STC after co-DE trial, granted

AMENDED CASH BOND
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $5,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his release from jail.  
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Saul G.-R., Juan A.-V., Erlin V. or Rudy R.-M.
- Defendant shall not leave Dane County without prior approval of the Court.
